issues.title: ISIS-1509: Allow Factory Methods to be defined

commit.message: Merge branch 'maint-1.16.1'  (but reverts the change made while backporting of ISIS-1743)
Merge branch 'ISIS-1743' into maint-1.16.1
ISIS-1743: fixes backport issue
Merge branch 'maint-1.16.1'
Merge branch 'ISIS-1743' into maint-1.16.1
ISIS-1743: removes some unused imports from HelloWorldObject
ISIS-1743: also supports mixins specified using @Mixin(method="...") eg "act" or "coll" as well as the default "$$"
ISIS-1743 fa-Icon mapping for mixins using '$$' method names
Merge branch 'maint-1.16.1'

ISIS-1742: fixes bug that mixins not contributed by default.

Problem arose because of an incorrect inversion of the old deprecated NotContributedAs enum in terms of the new Contributed enum (NEITHER -> AS_BOTH)
Merge branch 'ISIS-1743'
ISIS-1743: removes some unused imports from HelloWorldObject
ISIS-1743: also supports mixins specified using @Mixin(method="...") eg "act" or "coll" as well as the default "$$"
ISIS-1743 fa-Icon mapping for mixins using '$$' method names
ISIS-1821 fix case of empty annot. list not handled correctly

ISIS-1808: extends Ticket (response of ErrorReportingService) to allow a "kitten URL" to optionally be returned.

Also updates documentation
ISIS-1812: implements getOnType for OTOA on mixed in, avoiding NPE when attempt to render such a property in a table.
ISIS-1813: bumps pom versions to 1.16.1-SNAPSHOT
ISIS-1814: adds support for @XmlTransient when validating for presence of @XmlJavaTypeAdapter on a LocalDate
Merge branch 'dev/2.0.0-M1'
ISIS-1465: improves the publish script
ISIS-1465: further tweak to docs
ISIS-1465: further updates to website publish process
ISIS-1465: updates to website/docs
Merge branch 'release-1.16.0-RC1'
ISIS-1465: minor fix for release script
fixes verification instructions for running simpleapp

repo.name: isis
repo.description: Apache Isis™ software is a framework for rapidly developing domain-driven apps in Java. Write your business logic in entities, domain services or view models, and the framework dynamically generates a representation of that domain model as a webapp or as a RESTful API. For prototyping or production.

issue_comments.body: Uh. I touched the archetypes' pom.xml again ..
Moved the changes to the apps.

I did a cherry pick of this pull request, just to see what happened.  Unlike https://github.com/apache/isis/pull/8, say, where I just did a straightforward merge and everything worked, with a cherry pick (in other words rebase) it seems that github isn't quite smart enough.  So in the future I'll merge PRs using a regular merge.  For this PR, I guess you'll need to close it manually.  I don't think I have the permissions to do that - do you?
As a reporter I can close it, yes.
Could you recreate the PR referencing ISIS-959 in the commit msg?
Done!

The PR is ready to be merged.
I'll see what kind of unit tests I can add.

Generally looks very good... thanks.  Only main issue is to rename ActionLayout.ClassFaPosition to ActionLayout.CssClassFaPosition.  
If you want to merge it in, I'm happy.
I'll squash it and merge it as a single commit.

Thanks! 
I've recommitted with the requested changes.

I'm not sure about this pull request.... seems that a new event is created for each phase.

In my original design I create a new event for hide, and for disable, but then reuse the same event for validate/pre-execute/post-execute.  This opens up the possibility that validation phase could (as a performance optimization) "push" results onto the event, to pass downstream to the later *execute phases.  That seems a good thing to me.

With your redesign, that wouldn't be possible.  

What issue does the new design address?

Problem is that previous design was not working properly, as it was getting the event from a ThreadLocal that could contain other Event dispatched "in the middle" of another Event's processing (ie, a wrapped property is set in the middle of another Event processing).

So it was reusing an Event that was not corresponding to the same one on previous phases.

As there can be multiple Events simultaneously executing, the only way I envision, if your use case must be supported, is to change from a ThreadLocal single "existingEvent", to a List of them.

HTH,

Oscar 

> El 7/2/2015, a las 12:29, Dan Haywood notifications@github.com escribió:
> 
> I'm not sure about this pull request.... seems that a new event is created for each phase.
> 
> In my original design I create a new event for hide, and for disable, but then reuse the same event for validate/pre-execute/post-execute. This opens up the possibility that validation phase could (as a performance optimization) "push" results onto the event, to pass downstream to the later *execute phases. That seems a good thing to me.
> 
> With your redesign, that wouldn't be possible.
> 
> What issue does the new design address?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub https://github.com/apache/isis/pull/22#issuecomment-73360587.

OK, understood.   In which case, your design wins.  
If later on we want to re-introduce the concept of reusing events between phases then we can put the extra machinery back in (Lists, etc).
I'll merge this shortly.

Many thanks, Dan.

> El 7/2/2015, a las 12:48, Dan Haywood notifications@github.com escribió:
> 
> OK, understood. In which case, your design wins.
> 
> If later on we want to re-introduce the concept of reusing events between phases then we can put the extra machinery back in (Lists, etc).
> I'll merge this shortly.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub https://github.com/apache/isis/pull/22#issuecomment-73361100.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ISIS-1110

The PR is applied manually.
Please close it.

I had added a neoapp example, but it may not make sense to merge back to master since there is a dependency on module [1] currently only available in source.

[1] https://github.com/jdbranham/isis/blob/master/example/application/neoapp/webapp/pom.xml#L256

Very belatedly, I got around to reviewing this and have merged into master under https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ISIS-1126.

Thanks!
Dan

Per neoapp, I've moved that code (plus the Sprint/isis-neo4j module) into isisaddons/isis-app-neoapp.  Haven't actually tried it out yet, but it compiles ok.  

The main PR is merged into the ISIS-789 branch; I intend to merge that into master next week, all being well.

The changes related to the task look good! Good job!

But I'll very grateful if you revert the formatting changes which are not related to the change and add a lot of noise in the diff. Probably you can use Isis' formatting style for your IDE - http://isis.apache.org/contributors/development-environment.html
Just to say that I'm currently reviewing/merging this in now.
resolved as https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ISIS-1083
In disorder , sorry the JIRA ISIS-1162

Thanks for this contribution... haven't forgotten about it, just need to find time to review.  Currently working towards putting out a 1.9.0 release, so hopefully later on this month.

thx again,
Dan

Oscar and I have been discussing on dev@isis.apache.org; think that this isn't required, because RepositoryService#persist(...) has these semantics already.  Oscar will update the docs to make this clearer, and (I believe) just close this PR.

Hi, happy with this PR, however I have no way to merge/close it because it seems that github - for some reason - is reporting it comes from an unknown repository.  
I'm going to apply the change manually; perhaps you could close this PR manually (we don't have permissions to do that ourselves).
Thx
Dan

Thanks Dan!
I'm closing this PR.

Thanks for taking the time doing this.

In fact, we generate the archetype from the simpleapp application (fyi as per [1])  

So could you make the equivalent changes to simpleapp?  (I can apply this PR or we can discard it... either way it'll be overwritten at the next release).

[1] http://isis.apache.org/guides/cgcom.html#_cgcom_cutting-a-release_releasing-the-archetype_create-the-archetype).

I fixed it in the simpleapp folder and I created a new pull request for that:
https://github.com/apache/isis/pull/46

many thanks, I'll review and merge.

> I fixed it in the simpleapp folder and I created a new pull request for
> that:
> #46 https://github.com/apache/isis/pull/46
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/isis/pull/45#issuecomment-215745673

commit_comments.body:
Is it possible that this code is ran simultaneously by several threads ?
Use ConcurrentMap instead ?!
Yup, agreed.  Will make that change.

better use:

```
LOG.info("isFixturesInstalled: {} = {}", INSTALL_FIXTURES_KEY, installFixtures);
```

This will not call `#toString()` on the parameters if INFO is not enabled for this logger.

what's the idea of the double negation ?
clearOriginalDestination > continueToOriginalDestination > clearOriginalDestination

There's a similar flag for "suppressRememberMe", trying to follow same pattern:
- in the viewer_wicket.properties, turning on the flag disables a feature ("suppressRememberMe", "clearOriginalDestination")
- in the signature of IsisSignInPanel (with rememberMe inherited), it's the negative.
- deriving the "clearOriginalDestination" local var is because that reflects the method to be called.
Thanks for the tip, implemented here.  I guess there's a longer job to do this throughout the codebase, is there any sort of tool to do this, do you know?
No. I am not aware of such tool.

Maybe it'd be useful to either log NSME or throw it as a cause of the new ISE.
Otherwise it is not clear which method is missing.
Maybe.  That said, WrapperObject is one of the Isis classes, so it would constitute a fairly significant bug if any of the methods couldn't be found.
I see. But still it won't do any harm to pass NSME as a cause. Just in case an unintentional change is made in refactoring. Or to make static analysis tools happy.
Agreed.  I won't put into 1.7.0 (unless RC1 fails its vote), but will add to 1.8.0.

is `fa` class required here ? I think it is not
earlier only `fa-xyz` is used.
this may confuse some users looking at the ToDo app

the "fa" class will be added automatically if omitted.  But I agree it's
potentially confusing.  So I've gone through and added the "fa" class
throughout the todoapp.

On 24 October 2014 07:33, Martin Grigorov notifications@github.com wrote:

> is fa class required here ? I think it is not
> earlier only fa-xyz is used.
> this may confuse some users looking at the ToDo app
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/isis/commit/2618e35b8e01e25064616465caadb1c5fb6efd30#commitcomment-8287088
> .
Might also want to do a quick review of ReferencePanel, which also uses Select2?
This problem is not in ReferencePanel. Maybe I have fixed it with this change.
Good enough.  Thx.
minor: this may be optimized with ConcurrentMap#putIfAbsent
`isInjectorMethod` seems to be not used
This looks like a bug. It passes the `hintKey` and `clearHint` later uses it to calculate a new hintKey at line 85.
Is the javadoc wrong now ? I see it is re-used for `OnSelectionHandler`
You may have removed/implemented this already. It is too late to fire the IDE and check it myself :-)
Actually I want to re-enable it for 1.9.0.

why so?  Doesn't the restyling get rid of all this per-component CSS?  Or are you saying you like the idea of different components _potentially_ being able to contribute their own CSS (even if most will provide very little)?
+1 on that.
Have fixed, will commit shortly.
Thanks, have removed, will commit shortly.
agreed, thanks... have fixed, will commit shortly.

maybe this needs a check for `null` ?!
- is it safe to assume that `get()` always return something for any domain object ?
- the map uses weak keys, so it is possible that an entry is GC-ed randomly
- what about decrementing to a negative value ?

Thanks for reviewing this Martin.
These are all valid points, and (at least in part) because I was a bit nervous of the complexity of this algorithm, a subsequent commit has refactored this code so that the EventBus is basically a singleton (application-scoped) object rather than request-scoped as it was as of this commit.
So, with that said, I don't think any of the points you've raised apply to the subsequent implementation.

Why this is commented out?
If the reason is good then it should be removed, not just commented out.
Is there any difference between `CssClassFaFacetForViewModelLayoutFactory` and `CssClassFaFacetForDomainObjectLayoutFactory`?

Please revive the tests in this class.

This class also looks very similar to CssClassFaFacetForDomainObjectLayoutFactory.
I'll have to check the current code to see why both of them are needed.

—

Persönlich haftende Gesellschafterin: Kühne & Nagel A.G., Rechtsform: Aktiengesellschaft nach luxemburgischem Recht, HR-Nr.: B 18745, Geschäftsführendes Verwaltungsratsmitglied: Karl Gernandt.
Geschäftsleitung Region Westeuropa: Yngve Ruud (Vors.), Richard Huhn, Björn Johansson, Jan Kunze, Bruno Mang, Stefan Paul, Holger Ketz, Dominic Edmonds.

Wir arbeiten ausschließlich auf Grundlage der Allgemeinen Deutschen Spediteursbedingungen (ADSp), jeweils neuester Fassung. Wir verweisen insbesondere auf die vom Gesetz abweichenden Haftungsbeschränkungen von Ziffer 23 und 24 ADSp. Den vollständigen Text der ADSp übersenden wir Ihnen gerne auf Anfrage und können Sie auch unter http://www.kuehne-nagel.com einsehen. Ergänzend wird vereinbart, dass (1) Ziffer 27 ADSp im Rahmen internationaler Übereinkommen weder unsere Haftung noch die Zurechnung des Verschuldens von Leuten und sonstigen Dritten zu Gunsten des Auftraggebers erweitert, und (2) wir in den im deutschen Seehandelsrecht aufgeführten Fällen des nautischen Verschuldens oder Feuer an Bord nur für eigenes Verschulden und (3) im Sinne der CMNI genannten Voraussetzungen nicht für nautisches Verschulden, Feuer an Bord oder Mängel des Schiffes haften.

review_comments.body:
Hi guys,

Coincidentally, I'm just merging this stuff in now.  Should be hitting
master in next half hour or so.

Cheers
Dan

> In

> >   +import org.apache.isis.core.metamodel.facets.members.cssclassfa.CssClassFaFacetAbstract;

> 
> No. Leave it as is. Maybe there is a reason why there are both classes.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/isis/pull/29/files#r28960421.

There could be a rare issue with this... the arguments are used to create a cache key, and because you've used the AIFWQRC.class and "invoke" itself, rather than that of the target method that's ultimately called, it's conceivable that caching could occur incorrectly.

eg:
someObject.foo(int, int) -> someObject.bar(int, int)

If both "foo" and "bar" were marked to be cached, then the "foo" cache could be used for "bar".

I will try to reference originally invoked action class and action name
That way, same cache is used when invoked explicitly on the domain logic.
